title: Why do some people view Warren G Harding as one of the worst presidents ever? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I don’t think Warren G. Harding is at the bottom of the barrel. But he’s definitely far from even the center of the list. He might be the worst president of the 20th century. It’s important to note that Harding himself was, for the most part, not corrupt (as far as we know). Harding’s accomplishments are often forgotten as well. His administration oversaw the first unified budget, landmark anti-lynching laws, and a growing economy. However, the booming economy was due to his free market policies. In other words, he allowed the economy to boom by doing as little as possible. Harding’s administration was extremely corrupt, the prime example being the Teapot Dome Scandal. His death was sudden, and some say his wife killed him as retribution for his numerous affairs (just a story). In other words, Harding’s presidency was inconsequential. He is viewed as a weak leader who was more focused on parties than politics and appointed corrupt friends to administrative positions. Was he a good president? No. Was he the worst? No.

He was a “dark horse” nominee and was the leader of corrupt administration know as the “Ohio Gang.” He, himself said he should have never been President. A womanizer, he fathered a child in a White House closet. The Teapot Dome scandal happened during his administration but was revealed after his death. Secretary of the Interior Albert Fall went to prison for corruption. You have to go a long way to find a political leader in America less qualified to be President of the United States than Warren G. Harding. Teapot Dome scandal - Wikipedia . DNA proves President Harding fathered child out of wedlock . . Albert B. Fall - Wikipedia
